Respected Retail Professional who leverages expertise in production, negotiation, supplier management, and relationship building skills, to drive and deliver solid business results.
Highly adept with working  with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders to maximize business opportunities .
Strong leadership skills, demonstrated success with managing initiatives of varying scope and sizes, and working collaboratively for optimal results.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Manager, Product Management - Merchandising (Hybrid - Seattle)

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Job Description

Are you an inspirational and hands-on product leader who can make a huge impact on a dynamic, fast-moving business? Do you have a passion for innovation and retail? The Senior Manager of Product Management will be responsible for coaching and developing a team of high-performing product managers as we modernize our approach to merchandising to drive a customer led, data driven approach to all aspects of inventory planning, product selection, vendor management, and inventory ordering areas.

The Senior Manager of Product Management for Merchandising Technology is a key member of the Nordstrom Product Management team, responsible for setting the vision and driving the technical capabilities that power our teams and business. To accomplish this, product managers set the vision, plan the product roadmap, lead product discovery, deliver solutions and measure results. The Senior Manager of Product Management must have a strong analytical and data driven mindset and a relentless focus on the outcomes we are driving towards. This person should have a high bar for performance and a drive to win and ability to inspire. This role partners closely with leaders across merchandising, operations, UX, and software engineering. This is a highly visible and critical role to Nordstrom, and the ideal candidate will have a balance of business and technical acumen as well as a demonstrated ability to deliver value iteratively while making meaningful progress on broader longer-term strategies/initiatives.

We are seeking a dynamic candidate who has demonstrated success in rapidly evolving environments, adeptly managing shifting priorities to deliver exceptional products and features. The ideal candidate should be a decisive leader, capable of setting priorities while remaining flexible, articulating vision and strategy, and fostering a culture of performance and excellence. In addition to individual excellence, the ideal candidate will possess outstanding teamwork skills, thriving in collaboration with colleagues to achieve shared goals and drive forward collective success.

A day in the life…

Advanced Capability with the following competencies, requiring little day to day management support:

Leads a team of product managers while contributing directly to product strategies and delivery of merchandising technology solutionsEffectively balance strategic, tactical, and operational aspects of the roleDevelops a deep understanding of the supported capabilities, processes, technologies, and user communityDevelops and presents product plans for roadmap items, align key stakeholders and secure stakeholder buy-in to influence outcomeBuilds strong partnerships across all of Nordstrom to identify synergy opportunities and drive product innovation to accelerate our missionRecruits, hires, and develops an efficient and effective team that meets the needs of the product management strategiesEvaluates team performance, assignments, and strategy, ensuring that we are developing phenomenal products, inclusive teams, and engaged employeesDrives operational excellence within the Product Management discipline internally and working with Product Management organizations across the enterpriseCollaborates with peers and leaders across the enterprise to solicit needs, define vision and ensure outcomes align with enterprise priorities and goalsUses a range of qualitative and quantitative inputs and perspectives to expose known and unknown problem areas and clearly define prioritized opportunities for execution againstDrives ownership of features and services throughout the product lifecycle for our cross-channel customer experiencesMonitors & identifies customer needs and respond by adjusting user experiences and product roadmapsMaintains a strong understanding of available technologies and apply technology solutions, where appropriate, to improve efficiency and ultimately benefit the customerStays on top of industry & market trends, performs market & business analysis, establishes & communicates thought-leadershipChampions our culture and values

You own this if you have…

Minimum 8 years’ experience with 3+ years of management experience, specifically in product managementAbility to inspire others, including demonstrated experience managing and leading strong teamsAbility to define, measure and analyze processes to identify improvement opportunitiesTechnical background and understanding of software development principlesAbility to build relationships cross-functionally with multiple teams from areas such as Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, UX, and business at multiple levelsDemonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in an innovative and fast-paced environmentExcellent business judgment, strong written and oral communication skills, and a practical, common sense approach to getting things doneConfidence representing your team & products, presenting vision & priorities to internal stakeholders, customers, and partners. You enjoy speaking opportunities and have a proven experience presenting to large teams and leadership. You are a speaker and evangelist.Demonstrated ability to collaborate with, learn from, and teach others across multiple disciplines. You’re comfortable with ambiguous and rapidly changing projects – and are a team player.Passion and ability to recruit talent. In this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!Strong learning mindset. You enjoy learning new things and see challenges as growth opportunities. You excel at mastering technical products and being the go-to person in your domain. (enterprise applications and data products don’t intimidate you).Bias for action - you are intrinsically motivated and gifted at driving work from start to finish. You are a self-starter.

We’ve got you covered…

Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:

Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time AwayLife Insurance and DisabilityMerchandise Discount and EAP Resources

A few more important points...

The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.

Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.

© 2022 Nordstrom, Inc

Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.

Pay Range Details

The pay range(s) below are provided in compliance with state specific laws. Pay ranges may be different in other locations.

Washington: $162,000 - $297,000 Annually

This position may be eligible for performance-based incentives/bonuses. Benefits include 401k, medical/vision/dental/life/disability insurance options, PTO accruals, Holidays, and more. Eligibility requirements may apply based on location, job level, classification, and length of employment. Learn more in the Nordstrom Benefits Overview by copying and pasting the following URL into your browser: https://careers.nordstrom.com/pdfs/Ben_Overview_17-19.pdf

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
